findings.description: Example shows malformed account ID '5b10a2844c20165700ede21g' with invalid 'g' character at end. Valid JIRA account IDs use base64 alphanumeric characters only (ending with letters a-f, or numbers).
findings.impact: Users copying this example will experience user resolution failures or authentication errors
findings.recommendation: Replace with valid account ID format: '5b10a2844c20165700ede21e' or use placeholder like 'user@example.com'

findings.documented_value: Listed in Available Commands table but no usage examples provided
findings.description: The update-fields command exists and is listed in the Available Commands section but has zero usage examples. Users cannot determine the correct JSON format for custom fields.
findings.impact: Users cannot use the update-fields command without external documentation. High chance of failed attempts.
findings.recommendation: Add examples section with: 'jira-as collaborate update-fields PROJ-123 --fields '{"customfield_10014": "value", "customfield_10016": 5}' and explain JSON field mapping

findings.description: Documentation only shows markdown format example but actual CLI supports three options: text (plain), markdown (GitHub-style), and adf (Atlassian Document Format for rich formatting). Missing documentation for ADF format.
findings.impact: Users won't discover ADF capability for advanced rich text formatting (tables, code blocks, etc.)
findings.recommendation: Document all three format options. Add example: 'jira-as collaborate comment add PROJ-123 --body {...} --format adf' and explain when to use each format

findings.description: Documentation doesn't clarify that --id, --name, and --all are mutually exclusive options. Users might attempt to combine them.
findings.impact: Users may write invalid command lines combining multiple options
findings.recommendation: Add note: 'Choose ONE of: --id (download by attachment ID), --name (download by filename), --all (download all attachments)' and show example of each

findings.description: Examples use '--output-dir' but actual CLI provides shorter alias '-o'. Documentation doesn't mention short form availability.
findings.impact: Users won't know about faster typing option with '-o'
findings.recommendation: Update examples to show: 'jira-as collaborate attachment download PROJ-123 --id 12345 --output-dir ./downloads/' (or use '-o' as alias)

findings.description: Examples use '--output' but CLI also provides short form '-o'. Additionally, examples don't show difference between table and json output formats.
findings.impact: Users may not discover json output option for programmatic parsing
findings.recommendation: Add example showing both formats: 'jira-as collaborate activity PROJ-123 --output json' and explain output format differences

findings.documented_value: --field-type custom shown, but 'jira' type not documented
findings.description: Example shows '--field-type custom' but doesn't document that '--field-type jira' also exists for filtering standard JIRA fields (status, assignee, etc.)
findings.impact: Users may not know how to filter standard JIRA fields vs custom fields
findings.recommendation: Add example: 'jira-as collaborate activity PROJ-123 --field-type jira --field status' to show filtering standard fields

findings.description: Documentation shows '--order asc' but doesn't document or show '--order desc' option for reverse chronological sorting
findings.impact: Users may not discover reverse sort capability for viewing oldest comments first
findings.recommendation: Add example: 'jira-as collaborate comment list PROJ-123 --order desc --limit 10' to show reverse chronological order

findings.description: Examples use long forms (--add, --remove, --list) but CLI provides shorter aliases (-a, -r, -l). Documentation doesn't mention short forms.
findings.impact: Users typing long forms when shorter options available
findings.recommendation: Add note: 'Short forms available: -a (add), -r (remove), -l (list)' or update examples to use short forms

findings.description: Documentation correctly shows '--dry-run' example, but should emphasize it's recommended for preview before deletion
findings.impact: Minor - documentation is accurate but could emphasize safety
findings.recommendation: Add note: 'Always use --dry-run first to preview deletion before using --yes'

findings.description: Example shows '-i' (short form) but documentation discusses long form '--id' elsewhere. Inconsistency in which form is primary.
findings.impact: Minor - both forms work but documentation is inconsistent
findings.recommendation: Standardize on showing both long and short forms throughout: '(-i, --id)' instead of just '--id'

findings.description: Documentation correctly shows both --file and --name options, but doesn't document short forms -f and -n
findings.impact: Users typing longer options when shorter forms available
findings.recommendation: Update examples to show: '--file (-f) screenshot.png --name (-n) evidence.png' for clarity

comment_list.documented: All options mentioned but short forms inconsistently shown

attachment_download.constraints: Must use exactly one of: --id, --name, or --all
attachment_download.documented: Options exist but mutual exclusivity not explained

activity.documented: All options mentioned but field-type jira variant not shown

watchers.documented: All documented but short forms not mentioned

update-fields.documented: Command exists but zero usage examples provided

critical_priority: Fix malformed account ID example in notify command (line 170) - replace '5b10a2844c20165700ede21g' with valid ID
Add usage examples for update-fields command with JSON field syntax
Document all comment format options (text, markdown, adf) with examples of when to use each
high_priority: Clarify that attachment download options (--id, --name, --all) are mutually exclusive
Document short form aliases for common options (-a, -o, -l, etc.)
Add example showing activity filtering by standard JIRA fields (--field-type jira)
medium_priority: Show both output format options for activity and comment list (text/json vs table/json)
Document watchers add/remove input can be email or account ID
Emphasize --dry-run for preview operations before deletion
low_priority: Standardize short/long form option presentation throughout documentation
Add note about JIRA field ID discovery for update-fields command
Document format differences between output options (text vs json vs table vs adf)
